data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Irritating Pollen
abilities.text: Each player can't play any Item cards from his or her hand.

data.flavorText: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Allergy Panic
abilities.text: Apply Weakness for each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) as ×4 instead.

attacks.name: Pollen Spray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

data.name: Vileplume-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fragrant Flower Garden
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Massive Bloom
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Allergic Explosion-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Pollen Defense
abilities.text: If an attack does damage to Erika's Vileplume while it's your Active Pokémon (even if it's Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. This power works even while Erika's Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: If Erika's Vileplume does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove a number of damage counters from Erika's Vileplume equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Erika's Vileplume has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Disgusting Pollen
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Downer Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

data.name: Vileplume

attacks.name: Paradise Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 2 damage counters from Vileplume (1 if it only has 1). Then, if you have any Benched Pokémon with damage counters on them, choose 1 of them and remove 2 damage counters from it (1 if it only has 1).

attacks.name: Horrid Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes a loud jangling noise when it shakes its petals to spread poison powder.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Varied Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose Asleep, Burned, Confused, or Poisoned. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

data.name: Dark Vileplume

abilities.name: Hay Fever
abilities.text: No Trainer cards can be played. This power stops working while Dark Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Whirlwind
attacks.text: Flip a coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, Dark Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: Perhaps because of their strong-smelling pollen, other Pokémon do not approach areas where Vileplumes live.

data.name: Vileplume δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Psychic Metal type.

abilities.name: Poison Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Trainer card in your opponent's hand.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

attacks.name: Poison Scent
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Asleep.

attacks.name: Addictive Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Supporter cards during his or her next turn.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Allergy Flower
abilities.text: Each player can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Dazzling Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

abilities.name: Hay Fever
abilities.text: No Trainer cards can be played. This power stops working while Dark Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Whirlwind
attacks.text: Flip a coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, Dark Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: Perhaps because of their strong-smelling pollen, other Pokémon do not approach areas where Vileplumes live.

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Energy Reaction
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you attach a Grass or Psychic Energy card from your hand to Vileplume (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), you may use this power. If you attach a Grass Energy card, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If you attach a Psychic Energy card, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Disturbing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

attacks.name: Poison Scent
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Asleep.

attacks.name: Addictive Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Supporter cards during his or her next turn.

abilities.name: Poison Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused.

data.name: Vileplume ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Block Dust
abilities.text: As long as Vileplume ex is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards (except for Supporter cards) from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Special Formula
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Vileplume-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fragrant Flower Garden
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Massive Bloom
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Allergic Explosion-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fragrant Flower Garden

attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Vileplume

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Allergy Storm
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Supporter cards from their hand. If tails, during your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.

data.flavorText: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Fully Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Fully Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

data.name: Vileplume

attacks.name: Pollen Bomb
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Lively Flower
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.flavorText: The bud bursts into bloom with a bang. It then starts scattering allergenic, poisonous pollen.
